page.title: 12Buildings in Lockerley
page.content: Lockerley has always been a farming community and the names of some of the houses give us clues about this life eg. Meadow End, Horseshoe Cottage, Drove End, Hill View, Green View, The Cricketers, Hawkstone Cottage, Holbury View and Beech Cottage. Drove End Cottage reminds us of the time when the sheep were taken to market at the sheep fair near Andover. We have a shepherd who lives and works in Lockerley. Until recently, the Lockerley Hall Estate has been the most important influence in the village. Some villagers live in Estate houses as tenants and work on the Estate. Mary Langdown lives in one of these houses and at present it is having a new tiled roof. However, in the village you will find alternative roofing materials such as thatch.
